intro: Hessea tenuipedicellata, commonly known as the narrow-fruited hessian, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique botanical features include narrow, thread-like fruits and a compact growth habit. Hessea tenuipedicellata is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
